title: Pictures not showing?
content:
Am I the only one who's having trouble with the PCKF? Pictures, such as the top banner, don't display, in Internet Explorer 7 (WinXP) or Firefox 2.0 (GNU/Linux).------------------------------

title: Re: Pictures not showing?
content: Yep, I'm having the same problem. Some trouble with CC314, it would seem.

title: Re: Pictures not showing?
content:
Now I remember, the pictures are loaded from CC314 indeed. The problem is I can't see whether a subforum has new messages or not, amongst other issues.

[quote]Quote:[hr]
Welcome to ClassicGaming.com! The page you are looking for cannot be found. We recently underwent a redesign, so the location of the page you are looking for has likely changed. Please take a look at the links to the left or use our site search to find what you are looking for.
[hr][/quote]

What the hell? If eK, Cho'gall or Flaose don't do anything about this the site will not exist anymore then?------------------------------

Hopefully they'll come back soon. Its annoying to read the forum with text replacing all the pictures...-Genius314

title: Re: Pictures not showing?
content:
Yeah, I noticed it too, but there isn't anything I can do about it.

I really hope someone has backup of all those emoticons, in case the files have disappeared from wherever they're stored. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

Backed up the site, somehow. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img]

OK, let's see this awkwardness:
[img]http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/images/sss1.png[/img]

Wow, wget -r is a really powerful command line tool. I think I mirrored the whole CC314 website in my hard disk.
